meanings.definition: The action or process of arranging or being arranged in layers.
meanings.sent1: The stratification of the soil helps us understand its composition better.
meanings.sent2: The geologist studied the stratification of the rock formations to learn about their history.
meanings.sent3: The cake's delicious stratification of chocolate and vanilla layers made it irresistible.
meanings.sent4: In the stratification of society, the wealthy elite occupy the highest layer.
meanings.sent5: The artist used different colors to show the stratification of the painting's layers.

meanings.definition: A system or arrangement of layers or levels.
meanings.sent1: The stratification of the company's management structure was clear from top to bottom.
meanings.sent2: The stratification of the atmosphere into different layers helps regulate temperature on Earth.
meanings.sent3: The stratification of books on the shelf by genre made it easy to find the right one.
meanings.sent4: The stratification of the ocean into zones supports diverse marine life.
meanings.sent5: The stratification of the building's floors allowed for efficient movement of people.
